children.translated_text: The first effusion
By whose opening and closing of the eyes, the dissolution and creation of the world occur,
we praise <s>Śaṅkara</s>, the origin of the power and glory of the <s>Śakti</s> circle.

children.text: yatra sthitam idaṃ sarvaṃ kāryaṃ yasmāc ca nirgataṃ |
children.translated_text: Where this entire effect is situated, from which it has emerged,
because of its unobstructed nature, there is no cessation anywhere.
Even in the distinctions such as waking, it pervades in its undivided form,
it does not withdraw from its own nature due to the perceiver.

children.text: ahaṃ sukhī ca duḥkhī ca raktaś ca ityadisamvidaḥ |
children.translated_text: "I am happy, I am sorrowful, I am attached," such cognitions,
clearly exist elsewhere, interwoven with states of happiness and the like.

children.text: na duḥkhaṃ na sukhaṃ yatra na grāhyam grāhakaṃ na ca |
children.translated_text: Where there is neither sorrow nor happiness, neither the grasped nor the grasper,

children.text: na cāsti mūḍhabhāvo 'pi tad asti paramārthataḥ || 5 ||
children.translated_text: nor is there a state of delusion, that exists in the highest reality.
Since this group of instruments, though deluded, behaves like the undeluded itself,
with the internal wheel, there is creation, maintenance, and dissolution.
One attains that essence through effort, examining with reverence,
because its independence is this, everywhere, uncontrived.
For this does not function as an instigator of desire and impulse,

children.text: api tv ātmabalasparśāt puruṣas tatsamo bhavet || 8 ||
children.translated_text: but by the touch of self-power, a man becomes equal to that.
For one desiring action, incapable due to inner impurity,

children.text: yadā kṣobhaḥ pralīyeta tadā syāt paramam padam || 9 ||
children.translated_text: when the agitation dissolves, then the supreme state is attained.
Then his uncontrived nature is characterized by knowing and doing,

children.text: yatas tadepsitaṃ sarvaṃ jānāti ca karoti ca || 10 ||
children.translated_text: because he knows and accomplishes all that is desired.
Observing his nature with the attitude of a ruler,

children.text: smayamāna ivāste yas tasyeyaṃ kusṛtiḥ kutaḥ || 11 ||
children.translated_text: he seems to smile, for where is this bad conduct for him?

children.text: nābhāvo bhāvyatām eti na ca tatrāsty amūḍhatā |
children.translated_text: Non-existence does not become real, nor is there non-delusion there,
because from the touch of effort, there is certainty that it was.
Therefore, that is known as artificial, always like the state of deep sleep,

children.text: na tv evaṃ smaryamāṇatvaṃ tat tattvam pratipadyate || 13 ||
children.translated_text: but such memorization does not attain that reality.
The pair of states here is termed as effect and doership,

children.text: kāryatā kṣayiṇī tatra kartṛtvam punar akṣayam || 14 ||
children.translated_text: effecthood is perishable there, while doership is again imperishable.

children.text: kāryonmukhaḥ prayatno yaḥ kevalaṃ so 'tra lupyate |
children.translated_text: The effort inclined towards effect alone is here destroyed,
when that is destroyed, the ignorant assumes "I am destroyed."
But the inner-directed state, which is the abode of omniscience,
its loss may sometimes occur due to the non-perception of another.
Its realization is always unwavering in the three states,

children.text: nityaṃ syāt suprabuddhasya tadādyante parasya tu || 17 ||
children.translated_text: it is eternal for the well-awakened, in the beginning and end of the other.
Endowed with the supreme power of the nature of knowledge and the known,

children.text: padadvaye vibhur bhāti tadanyatra tu cinmayaḥ || 18 ||
children.translated_text: in the two states, the all-pervasive shines, but elsewhere, it is consciousness itself.
The effusions of qualities and others, from the support of the general vibration,
having gained self-attainment, are always without obstruction for the knower.
But for the unawakened intellects, these are inclined to obstruct their own state,
they cause a fall into the difficult-to-cross, terrible path of <s>saṃsāra</s>.
Therefore, always engaged in distinguishing the essence of vibration,
one quickly realizes one's own nature even while awake.

children.text: atikruddhaḥ prahṛṣṭo vā kiṃ karomīti vā mṛśan |
children.translated_text: Whether extremely angry, pleased, or pondering "What should I do?",

children.text: dhāvan va yat padaṃ gacchet tatra spandaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ || 22 ||
children.translated_text: or running, whatever state one reaches, there the vibration is established.

children.text: yām avasthāṃ samālambya yad ayam mama vakṣyati |
children.translated_text: Relying on whatever state, whatever this one will say to me,
he stands resolved, "I will certainly do that."
Relying on that, by the upward path, both <s>Candra</s> and <s>Sūrya</s>,
having abandoned the path of <s>Sauṣumna</s>, reach the realm of <s>Brahma</s>.
Then, in that great sky, with the moon and sun dissolved,
like the state of deep sleep, the deluded becomes awakened, unobstructed.
The second effusion
Having seized that strength, the <s>mantras</s>, endowed with the power of omniscience,
operate for authority, like the organs for embodied beings.
There itself, they dissolve, peaceful in form, stainless,
along with the mind of the worshipper, these are of the nature of <s>Śiva</s>.
Since the living being is all-pervading, from the emergence of all states,
by the nature of that awareness, through the realization of identity.

children.text: tasmāc chabdārthacintāsu na sāvasthā na yā śivaḥ |
children.translated_text: Therefore, in the contemplation of sound and meaning, there is no state which is not <s>Śiva</s>
The enjoyer, by the nature of the enjoyable, is always established everywhere

children.text: iti vā yasya saṃvittiḥ krīḍātvenākhilaṃ jagat |
children.translated_text: Thus, for whom there is awareness that the entire world is a play

children.text: sa paśyan satataṃ yukto jīvanmukto na saṃśayaḥ || 5 ||
children.translated_text: He, seeing constantly, is united and liberated while living, without doubt
This indeed is the arising of that which is to be meditated upon in the mind of the meditator
The attainment of identity with that, for the aspirant who desires it
This indeed is the attainment of immortality, this indeed is the grasping of the self
This is the initiation into liberation, which grants the true nature of <s>Śiva</s>
The third effusion
Having caused the rise of <s>Soma</s> and <s>Sūrya</s>, accomplishes for the embodied
As desired, the creator, having established the meanings in the heart while awake
Similarly, in dreams, the desired objects, due to the absence of transgression
Always more clearly, established in the middle, will definitely reveal

children.text: anyathā tu svatantrā syāt sṛṣṭis taddharmakatvataḥ |
children.translated_text: Otherwise, creation would be independent, due to its nature
Always, like the worldly one, in the two states of waking and dreaming

children.text: yathā hi artho 'sphuṭo dṛṣṭaḥ sāvadhāne 'pi cetasi |
children.translated_text: Just as an object, indistinct, is seen even in a focused mind
Appears clearer, enhanced by one's own effort

children.text: tathā yat paramārthena yena yatra yathā sthitam |
children.translated_text: Thus, that which is in reality, by which, where, as it is established

children.text: tat tathā balam ākramya na cirāt sampravartate || 5 ||
children.translated_text: That, thus seizing strength, does not take long to manifest
Even the weak, seizing that, proceeds in action

children.text: ācchādayed bubhukṣāṃ ca tathā yo 'ti bubhukṣitaḥ || 6 ||
children.translated_text: Covers hunger, thus one who is very hungry
In this body, established, as omniscience and others
Thus, by establishment in one's self, it will be everywhere
Weakness is a thief in the body, and its wandering is due to ignorance

children.text: tad unmeṣaviluptaṃ cet kutaḥ sā syād ahetukā || 8 ||
children.translated_text: If that is vanished in awakening, how can it be causeless?
For one engrossed in single thought, how can there be another arising?

children.text: unmeṣaḥ sa tu vijñeyaḥ svayaṃ tam upalakṣayet || 9 ||
children.translated_text: That awakening should be known, one should observe it oneself

children.text: ato bindur ato nādo rūpam asmād ato rasaḥ |
children.translated_text: From this, the point, from this the sound, from this the form, from this the essence
They proceed quickly, agitating the embodied
When, as if desiring to see all things, it pervades and abides

children.text: tadā kiṃ bahunoktena svayam eva avabhotsyate || 11 ||
children.translated_text: Then, what is the use of speaking much? One will know it oneself
Awakened, one should always remain, seeing the field with knowledge
Should place all in one, then not be afflicted by another
The enjoyment of the group of powers arising from the mass of sounds

children.text: kalāviluptavibhavo gataḥ san sa paśuḥ smṛtaḥ || 13 ||
children.translated_text: Having lost the wealth of art, gone, he is considered a bound soul
The loss of supreme nectar, for him whose consciousness arises
By that, he attains non-independence, and he is in the domain of the elements
In the covering of his own form, the powers are always arising
Because without the penetration of sound, consciousness does not arise
This is the action-based power, of <s>Śiva</s>, acting on the bound souls
Binding, established in its own path, known to bring about success
In the form of the rise of the elements, existing in the mind, ego, and intellect
Restrained by the eight-fold city, the arising of consciousness from that

children.text: bhuṅkte paravaśo bhogaṃ tadbhāvāt saṃsared ataḥ |
children.translated_text: Enjoys the experience, being dependent, from that state, he transmigrates
We explain the cause of this cycle of birth and dissolution

children.text: yadā tv ekatra saṃrūḍhas tadā tasya layodayau |
children.translated_text: When indeed established in one, then his dissolution and arising

children.text: niyacchan bhoktṛtām eti tataś cakreśvaro bhavet || 19 ||
children.translated_text: Restraining, he attains the state of enjoyer, then becomes the lord of the circle
The fourth effusion
The one who ferries across the ocean of deep doubt
I bow to that varied, wondrous teacher, with diverse meanings
Having obtained even the unobtainable, this wealth of knowledge, hidden in the heart's cave

children.text: vasuguptavac chivāya hi bhavati sadā sarvalokasya || 2 ||
children.translated_text: Like <s>Vasugupta</s>, it indeed becomes for the good of all the world
